conbody.p:
In the documentation, we refer to three locales:
Java System locale
This is the locale of your machine, which is automatically detected by your JVM. For and tools, the Java system locale determines the default locale.
Database territory
This is the territory associated with your database when it is created. By default, this is the same as the Java System locale. The database territory determines the language of database errors.
Tools Session locale
This locale is associated with your session, when using tools such as ij or dblook. This locale determines the language of messages, as well as the localized display format for numbers, dates, times, and timestamps. You can use the derby.ui.locale property to specify the session locale that should be used.
